conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each source and how baffles direct the flow.
Liquid from A starts from the leftmost position.
First baffle encountered by liquid from A is purple, angled downwards and slightly to the right.
Liquid from A hits the yellow baffle, angled to direct further to the right.
Liquid from A encounters the gray baffle, directing further to the right and slightly downwards.
Liquid from A will flow into container E.
Liquid from B starts from the middle position.
First baffle encountered by liquid from B is yellow, angled downwards and slightly to the right.
Liquid from B hits the gray baffle, angled to direct further to the right and slightly downwards.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
Liquid from C starts from the rightmost position.
First baffle encountered by liquid from C is gray, angled downwards and slightly to the left.
Liquid from C hits the brown baffle, angled to direct further to the left.
Liquid from C will flow into container D.
Final Answer: Liquid from A and B will flow into container E, and liquid from C will flow into container D.
